title: Should Riot Rework Urgot, delete him, or just keep him the way he is?
body:
Why don't we see Urgot at all? Why don't they make any more skins for him? Well, this is due to his low win rate and how he is played at all. His win rate is soooooo low, that no one can seem to win with him. He was released on August 14, 2010 and now he is almost a 4 year old champion.{{champion:6}}, but would he ever be changed? who knows. What do you think? 
Question- Should Riot Rework Urgot, delete him, or just keep him the way he is?
Answer 1- Rework
Answer 2-Delete him
Answer 3- Keep him the way he is.(crap)
Tell me your opinion about urgot pls :)

3 KEEEP

MY FAVOURITE CHAMP >_<
I would say rework him into this biomechanical munitions turret.

I would definitely say Rework.


I mean how would a low win rate even change the fact that he really needs a rework?
He could be doing a lot more damage then he is right now. Instead of his ULTIMATE changing positions of another champion, why not do something that does damage or takes away someones ult for half the cooldown it usually is, then urgot can use that ultimate of his opponent or something. That's my opinion. But I agree with all of these people.

Personally, I would have already tried urgot if not for one thing. I mean, he has homing rocket thingies and a shield, and a slow, and that cool ult.  HOMING ROCKET THINGIES.  HOW COOL IS THAT!

But his splash art is just blech.  If I got battlecast in hextech, I would probably give it a shot.  But without that, I cannot make myself deal with his splash, or with his ingame look.  

What I'm saying is that I think that if he got a visual rework, his playrate would go up.  I mean, taliyah's winrate is about 36, and people still play her (partly because she's new, but also cause she's got a pretty cool kit, I think)

Rework him obviously. 

Riot can't just delete a champion from the game. That would just be controversial (and I'm not saying this because I think all champions belong. If I could choose champions that were never made, it'd be Vladimir and Irelia. I've hated them for at least a year now). 

They have tried reworking Urgot, but each attempt hasn't hit a satisfying mark.  So he just isn't a high priority over other champions who can hit those marks.
Pretty sure he is slated for a rework but it won't be happening until at least next year.
He just isn't played enough to be on the game at all. Why would riot change him in a year, tbh I think its just a waste of time to wait a year for a urgot rework. Don't ya think?
Think of it like having writers block. Constantly hitting your head at the problem doesn't make it easier. Sometimes you need to keep away from it for a time to get a new perspective.
Pretty sure he's gonna get the works.
